A Year of #TidyTuesday https://nrennie.github.io/blog/2021-12-29-a-year-of-tidytuesday/ Wed, 29 Dec 2021 00:00:00 +0000
https://nrennie.github.io/blog/2021-12-29-a-year-of-tidytuesday/ One of my goals for 2021 was to participate in the #TidyTuesday challenge on a regular basis. This blog post reflects on the past year of data visualisations. For those of you who don’t know, #TidyTuesday is a weekly data challenge aimed at the R community. Every week a new dataset is posted alongside a chart or article related to that dataset, and ask participants explore the data. You can access the data and find out more here.

30 Day Map Challenge 2021 https://nrennie.github.io/blog/2021-12-01-30-day-map-challenge-2021/ Wed, 01 Dec 2021 00:00:00 +0000
https://nrennie.github.io/blog/2021-12-01-30-day-map-challenge-2021/ The #30DayMapChallenge is a daily mapping, cartography, and data visualization challenge aimed at the spatial community. Every day in November participants create a map with a given theme (e.g. population, monochrome, raster) and share their results Twitter using the #30DayMapChallenge hashtag. Check out the challenge here. Although I’ve been creating data visualisations for a while, I don’t normally have that many opportunities to work with spatial data. This year, I created all 30 maps (see below).
Viz For Social Good https://nrennie.github.io/blog/2021-09-13-viz-for-social-good/ Mon, 13 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000
https://nrennie.github.io/blog/2021-09-13-viz-for-social-good/ Viz For Social Good volunteers create informative and impactful data visualizations for mission-driven organizations across the globe. Check out the organisation here. Code available at: github.com/nrennie/Viz_For_Social_Good VFSG: Visualize Our Community Non-profits around the world are driving positive social change but some of them lack the in-house resources to effectively tell their story with the data they have. Viz For Social Good (VFSG) helps non-profits thrive by connecting talented community members with organizations in need of data visualization skill sets.

Check out the challenge here. Code available at: github.com/nrennie/dubois_challenge.
